message: Bob, I'm pleased to offer you a chance to own this truly unique product. Its value is undeniable, and I'm confident it will exceed your expectations. I'm initially offering it at $1,500,000.  Given its worth, I believe this is a very fair starting point for our discussion.
I appreciate your offer, Alice, but I'm looking to save some money. I'm willing to pay $1,200,000 for the product. I think this is a fair price considering its value and the market demand.
Bob, I appreciate your willingness to negotiate.  However, $1,200,000 significantly undervalues the true worth of this product.  To find a middle ground, I'm willing to come down to $1,350,000.

I understand that the product has significant value, but I'm still looking to save some money. I'm willing to pay $1,250,000 for the product. I think this is a fair compromise between the initial offer and my previous counteroffer.
Bob, I appreciate your persistence but the price you're suggesting doesn't reflect the true value of this product.  I'm willing to accept $1,300,000 - it's my final offer.
I'm getting close to your final offer, Alice, but I'm still trying to save some money. I'm willing to pay $1,275,000 for the product. I think this is a fair compromise between our positions.
